name: Application
description: Represents the top-level object that contains all globally addressable OneNote objects such as notebooks, the active notebook, and the active section.

properties.name: notebooks
properties.description: Gets the collection of notebooks that are open in the OneNote application instance. In OneNote Online, only one notebook at a time is open in the application instance.

methods.name: getActiveNotebook
methods.description: Gets the active notebook if one exists. If no notebook is active, throws ItemNotFound.

methods.name: getActiveNotebookOrNull
methods.description: Gets the active notebook if one exists. If no notebook is active, returns null.

methods.name: getActiveSection
methods.description: Gets the active section if one exists. If no section is active, throws ItemNotFound.

methods.name: getActiveSectionOrNull
methods.description: Gets the active section if one exists. If no section is active, returns null.

methods.name: getActivePage
methods.description: Gets the active page if one exists. If no page is active, throws ItemNotFound.

methods.name: getActivePageOrNull
methods.description: Gets the active page if one exists. If no page is active, returns null.

methods.name: getActiveOutline
methods.description: Gets the active outline if one exists, If no outline is active, throws ItemNotFound.

methods.name: getActiveOutlineOrNull
methods.description: Gets the active outline if one exists, otherwise returns null.

methods.name: navigateToPage
methods.description: Opens the specified page in the application instance.

methods.name: navigateToPageWithClientUrl
methods.description: Gets the specified page, and opens it in the application instance.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The client url of the page to open.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Fills the proxy object created in JavaScript layer with property and object values specified in the parameter.

parameters.name: param
parameters.description: Accepts parameter and relationship names as delimited string or an array. Or, provide [loadOption](loadoption.md) object.
